00060 /*
00061  * Deallocate any memory for all the class members.
00062  */
00063 void CPSIFileData::Clear()
00064 {
00065         m_ProbeSets.clear();
00066 }

00070 /*
00071  * Check for the file existance
00072  */
00073 bool CPSIFileData::Exists()
00074 {
00075         // Find the file stats.
00076         struct stat st;
00077         return (stat(m_strFileName.c_str(), &st) == 0);
00078 }
00079 
00081 
00082 /*
00083  * Read the file contents.
00084  */
00085 bool CPSIFileData::Read()
00086 {
00087         // Clear any existing data.
00088         Clear();
00089 
00090         // Open the mask file.
00091         ifstream instream(m_strFileName.c_str(), ios::in);
00092         if (!instream)
00093         {
00094                 Clear();
00095                 return false;
00096         }
00097 
00098         // The first line is the number of probe sets
00099         int nSets=0;
00100         const int LINELENGTH = 128;
00101         char str[LINELENGTH];
00102         instream.getline(str, LINELENGTH);
00103         if (sscanf(str, "#Probe Sets: %d", &nSets) == 0)
00104         {
00105                 Clear();
00106                 return false;
00107         }
00108 
00109         // The remaining lines contain the probe set names.
00110         m_ProbeSets.resize(nSets);
00111         int num;
00112         int iSet=0;
00113         char name[LINELENGTH];
00114         while (instream.getline(str, LINELENGTH))
00115         {
00116                 // Skip blank lines.
00117                 if (strlen(str) == 0)
00118                         continue;
00119 
00120                 // Parse and store the line.
00121                 sscanf(str, "%*s %s %d", name, &num);
00122                 m_ProbeSets[iSet].probeSetName = name;
00123                 m_ProbeSets[iSet].numberPairs = num;
00124                 ++iSet;
00125 
00126         }
00127         return true;
00128 }
